channel.title: Circle area generator!
channel.description:
Hi, I dont think this script will be of much use but i thought i might share it anyway. For homework i had to figure out the area of a circle with a 5cm radius i did this but then i got the idea of making a script for to get the answer. Because i recently quit rs i have been blank of ideas for scripts but this was a good idea!! anyway here is the script i hope you like it(it wasnt hard coz of scars "pi" function!!)
EDIT: I added a script that gets the area of an Annulus!!! its also attached
EDIT: Because the scripts arent that hard,well there really not hard at all i made ont that gets the area of the sector!! its also attached

item.title: Circle area generator!
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Annulus is areal(That a word?) difference between 2 concentric circles(Both middle points are same place)

Annulus = Area of larger circle take area of smaller circle;
PiLargerRadius^2 - PiSmallerRadius^2;
Pi*(LargerRadius^2 - SmallerRadius^2)

And yea, What Kane said for sectors

Read full topic

item.description:

ok thanks i got the anulus and i am just about to edit my post and add it…
EDIT: thanks kane when i get some time ima make that sector script!

item.title: Circle area generator!
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“sonny bill 9, post:3, topic:157510”]yeah it should…

EDIT: Fixed how do i mesure the area of a sector , i googled it but that didnt help

Is the annulus’ area, Pi * Radius squared - Radius of inner circle squared ?[/quote]

Area=(m/360)Pir^2

m= measurement of central angle
r= radius

from
http://library.thinkquest.org/20991/gather/formula/data/353.html

All you had to google was “formula sector circle”

Read full topic
